person.persName: Philip Burton Thompson, Sr. (Provisional Government of Kentucky)

body.p: A Kentucky attorney, soldier, and politician. Harrodsburg, Kentucky native. Son of John B. and Nancy Robards Thompson. Admitted to the bar in 1840 and practiced law in Mercer County, Kentucky. Married to Martha A. Montgomery Thompson. Father of Davis M. Thompson, Philip “Little Phil” Burton Thompson, Jr., and John Burton Thompson. Member of the Whig Party. Served as a captain in the Second Regiment Kentucky Foot Volunteers in the Mexican War from 1846 to 1847. Served as a member of the Council of Ten in the Provisional Government of Kentucky. Served on the Committee on Banks and Committee on Military Affairs for the Provisional Government of Kentucky.
